bug.author: CarloLucibello
bug.description:
julia> g1 = grad(tanh) (::gradfun) (generic function with 1 method)
julia> grad(tanh)(1.) == 1-tanh(1.)^2 true
julia> grad(g1)(2.) #BUG: returns nothing

comments.comment: this is still failing on master and julia 0.7

I found the bug, but now I am trying to understand how it relates to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MikeInnes>@MikeInnes</denchmark-link> 's PR. Basically in the line `og = r.func(Grad{i},n.outgrad,r.value,r.args...;r.kwargs...)` I should have used `r` instead of `r.value`. As soon as I figure out whether there is a relation to Mike's bug, I will push this. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
